sen.j: 丹後神野駅（たんごかんのえき）は、京都府京丹後市久美浜町浦明にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Located in Urake Kumihama-cho, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, Tango-Kanno Station is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Tango-Kanno Station, located in Urake Kumihama-cho, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Tango-Kanno Station, located in Urake Kumihama-cho, Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).

sen.j: 当駅は、鉄道駅簡易委託駅となっている。
sen.e: Simple jobs of this station are outsourced.
The simple jobs of this station are outsourced.
The simple jobs of this station are outsourced.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: It is located on the ground level, provided with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them.
Situated on the ground level, it's provided with two separate platforms serving two tracks between them.
Situated on the ground level, it's provided with two separate platforms serving two tracks between them.

sen.j: ホーム間の移動は、跨線橋を渡る形式ではなく、昔ながらの踏切形式である。
sen.e: With no bridge across railroads, you must still use a railroad crossing to move between the platforms.
With no bridge across railroads, one must still use a railroad crossing to move between the platforms.
With no bridge across railroads, one must still use a railroad crossing to move between the platforms.

sen.j: 古い木造駅舎が改築され、現在は可愛らしい感じの外観をした駅舎になっている。
sen.e: The old wooden station house has been reformed to the present one with a lovely outside view.
The old wooden station house has been reformed to the present one with a lovely view to the outside.
The old wooden station house has been reformed to the present one with a lovely view to the outside.

Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 小天橋海水浴場......日本の水浴場88選にも選ばれた著名な海水浴場である。
sen.e: The Shotenkyo sea-bathing beach: a famous sea-bathing beach that has been selected as one of the 88 most excellent sea-bathing beaches in Japan
The Shotenkyo sea-bathing beach is famous, having been selected as one of the 88 most excellent sea-bathing beaches in Japan.
The Shotenkyo sea-bathing beach is famous, having been selected as one of the 88 most excellent sea-bathing beaches in Japan.

sen.j: 久美浜を丸ごとプロデュースする店で、レストラン「めしーる」が併設されている。
sen.e: It is a store to show you all things typical to Kumihama, and the "Meshiru" restraunt is located there as well.
It's a store that displays all things typical of Kumihama, and the "Meshiru" restaurant is located there as well.
It's a store that displays all things typical of Kumihama, and the 'Meshiru' restaurant is located there as well.

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約88人である。
sen.e: The number of persons getting on board at this station is approx. 88 a day in the fiscal 2006.
In fiscal 2006, the average daily number of passengers who boarded at this station was 88.
In fiscal year 2006, the average daily number of passengers who boarded at this station was 88.

sen.j: 夏場の海水浴、冬場の牡蠣料理が名物となっており、また駅近くには小天橋海水浴場がある。
sen.e: Around the station, sea-bathing beaches in the summer and olyster cuisine in the winter are famous, with the Shotenkyo sea-bathing beach loacted near to the station as well.
Around the station, sea-bathing beaches in the summer and oyster cuisine in the winter are famous, and the Shotenkyo sea-bathing beach is close by too.
Around the station, sea-bathing beaches in the summer and oyster cuisine in the winter are famous, and the Shotenkyo sea-bathing beach is close by too.

sen.j: このため、夏場の利用客数はなかなか侮れない。
sen.e: Therefore, you cannot make light of the number of users of this station in the summer.

sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1932年8月10日 丹後木津（現在の木津温泉）～久美浜間が開業し全通。
sen.e: August 10, 1932: Operation between Tango-Kitsu (present Kitsu-onsen) and Kumihama started, completing the planned construction of the line.
August 10, 1932: The operation between Tango-Kitsu (present Kitsu-onsen) and Kumihama started, completing the planned construction of the line.
August 10, 1932: The operation between Tango-Kitsu (present Kitsu-onsen) and Kumihama started, completing the planned construction of the line.

sen.j: 峰山線・峰豊線を宮津線に改称したこの時に開業。
sen.e: Operation of this station started when the names of Mineyam Line and Minetoyo Line were changed to Mineyam Line.
The station was activated when the names of the Mineyama and Minetoyo lines were changed to the Mineyama Line.
The station was activated when the names of the Mineyama and Minetoyo lines were changed to the Mineyama Line.

sen.j: 1987年4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、西日本旅客鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - Due to the division and privitization of Japan National Railways, it became a station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
April 1, 1987: Due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways, it became a station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
April 1, 1987: Due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways, it became a station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 1990年4月1日 北近畿タンゴ鉄道への宮津線移管により、同鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1990 - The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and it became a station of the railway company.
April 1, 1990: The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and it became a station of that railway company.
April 1, 1990: The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and it became a station of that railway company.
